intro: Arctostaphylos arguta var. pyrifolia, commonly known as the Pacific madrone, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the western United States. It is characterized by its smooth, peeling bark and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers that appear in early spring. The plant produces edible berries that are typically consumed by birds and small mammals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
